question: In a common emitter amplifier, the output resistance is 5000 ohm and input resistance is 1000 ohm. If the peak value of signal voltage is 10 mV and current gain is 50, then the peak value of output voltage is [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: In a common emitter amplifier, the output resistance is $5000~\Omega$ and input resistance is $1000~\Omega$. If the peak value of signal voltage is $10~mV$ and current gain is $50$, then the peak value of output voltage is [MHT-CET 2020]
solution:
Voltage gain $A_{v} = \beta \frac{R_{o}}{R_{i}} = 50 \times \frac{5000}{1000} = 250$. 
 Output voltage $V_{o} = A_{v} V_{i} = 250 \times 10~mV = 2500~mV = 2.5$ V.
